text: I guess you could make the modules unavailable in templates, and then add them to the template files inside flexible columns or DND sections, but I guess someone could potentially delete one and not be able to add it back in

Does anyone know of a way to use a React component inside a single module / have a single module be a React component, while keep the rest of the modules/page “non-React”? >< Client wants their pages in HubSpot as normal modules, but wants to import and reuse the React navbar from their separate React site as the navbar in the HubSpot site so they can utilize a single codebase and still take advantage of its authentication and React rehydration... and yes, I have already advised them against this.
Sounds like the best fit would be the react boilerplate, which compiles an app into a single module

That's a wrapper for the entire app to be in React though, right? I want to just have a single React component, in a drag and drop template with normal HubSpot modules. Or am I misunderstanding how it works?
You can have an app with just one component
That’s usually what I use it for
